title: Katsucon 2016 Special
synopsis: Hosts Victoria Holden and Evan Minto present the best of Crunchyroll's coverage of Katsucon 2016! Danika gets the story behind some of the incredible cosplayers and their costumes on display at Katsucon, including an interview with Jessica Nigri, one of the world's best known cosplayers. Evan tours artist alley to discover the current trends in fan art. Then, Sam goes shopping in the dealer hall to meet the vendors and takes the opportunity to try on the latest in dieselpunk and steampunk fashion.

title: Demian
synopsis: A story about an elite government team that pilots a five into one super robot fighting force. They are called to take down their robot’s creator who is now a terrorist.

title: Episode 7
synopsis: Zaizen's 3-billion yen investment in "Game Crazy" has yield a profit of 300-million yen. Zaizen cheers in joy, but is scolded by a mysterious voice. Just who's voice could it have been!?

title: Episode 6
synopsis: Zen-san speaks about the new club member to Mr. Fujita, a member of the school founder's foundation, who is shaken upon hearing Zaizen's name. On the otherhand, Zaizen continues his exploration of the history of money through the Age of Discovery, fiancing, and banking.

title: Episode 5
synopsis: "Money is people. People are money." "Listen to the voice of money." These are the two phrases set Zaizen off on his journey through the history of money and civilizations.

title: Episode 4
synopsis: Zaizen attempts to purchase 3-billion yen worth of "Game Crazy," but is stopped by the vice-captain Watanabe. Watanabe then orders Tsukihama to teach Zaizen how to invest. Zaizen repeats that "inveestment is not about study," but is advised to come up with a stategy by Kamishiro.

title: Episode 3
synopsis: "Investment is not about study, it's about getting the hang of it." Or so the club captain Kamishiro said. Zaizen, still clue as how he will invest his 10-billion yen, begins his move by purchasing shares of "Game Crazy." less

title: Episode 2
synopsis: The "investment club" consists of only the top student from each of the 6 grades. Their annual goal is to yield a profit of 8% from a capital of 300-billion yen. As the top student of his grade, Zaizen Takashi is forced to join the investment club over playing on the baseball team. His first task at hand in the club is to invest 10-billion yen.

title: Episode 1b
synopsis: Dojuku Gakuen, a 130-year old super-advanced institute of higher education, has a secret. "The secret" of the school is concerns the existence of an "investment club," consisting only of the top student from each of the 6 grades. They must invest from a capital of 300-billion yen and yield a profit of 8%, which is their annual goal. This is why Dojuku Gakuen, boasting the highest standards of education in all of Japan, is tuition free. "The most exciting game in the world. The ultimate game of ultimate thrill… In other words, money… Investments!"

title: Episode 1a
synopsis: Zaizen Takashi passes his entrance exams as the top of the heap at Dojuku Gakuen, a 130-year old super-advanced institute of higher education. The day after the entrance ceremony, "the secret" of the school is revealed to him.

title: Chapter 2
synopsis: A mysterious young samurai named Hyakkimaru is traveling alone, slaying monsters along his way. One day he encounters a thief named Dororo who follows him, trying to steal his sword.

title: Chapter 1
synopsis: A warlord named Daigokagemitsu makes a deal with forty-eight demons and promises to offer his unborn child in exchange for realizing his ambition to conquer the country. Later on his son is born with unbearable fate.

title: Let's All Be Weird!?
synopsis: Do you get along with weirdos?

title: Reunion! That Classmate You Like!?
synopsis: Takahashi runs into an old classmate who asks about his life as a newscaster.

title: Welcome to Dinosaur Village!?
synopsis: Tonight on World Fool News: A water pipe burst, a dinosaur fossil is discovered, and a super baby.

title: JOYnt! is Here!? Part 2
synopsis: JOYnt host are continuing to annoy the crew of World Fool News.

title: JOYnt! is Here!? Part 1
synopsis: Isn’t it Naigayara Falls?

title: A Day Off All By Myself!?
synopsis: A request to buy noodles causes Takahashi to have flashbacks.

title: Usui-san Falls in Love!?
synopsis: Usui complicated love triangle.

title: Let's Take the Trolley!?
synopsis: Tonight, a report about the Rose Garden in Shikishima, a crushing injury to a promising athlete, and “Let’s keep News Upbeat”

title: The Steamy Incident at the Kusatsu Hot Springs!?
synopsis: While on location at a hot spring, Miki tries to keep it together.

title: Shimohira-san's Day Off!?
synopsis: Takahashi is a stalker?!

title: The Show Begins!?
synopsis: Takahashi first show introduces a new set of weirdness.

title: The Melancholy of a New Newscaster!?
synopsis: A big promotion to a nightly news program is not what it seems to be.

title: When You Start to Wonder About Your Roots, Is Thinking 24/7 Ever Enough?
synopsis: MILPOM, SILKY, CACAO and HAPPY hold a photo session in the woods, brandishing their smartphones. While they're totally into their shooting, HAPPY disappears all of a sudden. A certain doom falls on MILPOM and the others! Can the four girls survive it!?

title: Doesn't Simply Watching Cooking Videos Make You Feel Like You're a Master Chef?
synopsis: The foursome of MILPOM, SILKY, CACAO and HAPPY challenge to make a character-themed lunch as it's so popular today. Their kyara-ben, be delicious!

title: Isn't It A Reality That You'll Be Likened To A Smartmouthed Adolescent If You Speak Of Your Dreams And That You'll Be Shunned For Being Snobbish If You Talk About Your Future?
synopsis: MILPOM, SILKY, CACAO and HAPPY unveil their ambitions, one-by-one, as they’re interviewed on the street in Harajuku…!

title: The Person You Fall for Is Your Type. Isn't That an Urban Legend?
synopsis: SILKY, CACAO, and HAPPY visit the café where MILPOM works part-time. They chat about their ideal type of men, which turns into a crazy girl talk!

title: What Kind of Bird is a Turkey Anyway?!
synopsis: When Christmas is fast approaching, MILPOM and her friends visit the nail salon that HAPPY recommends. They wait for their turn too long and an unexpected happening occurs!

title: Pumpkin Pie is Hard to Say!
synopsis: The story takes place in a certain ordinary town where it is natural for everyone to wear an animal costume head. It depicts the everyday life of the main character MILPOM and her friends who live there, filled with the essence of Kawaii and a little bit cynical girls.

title: Episode 6
synopsis: Prospects for defeating the Morbeens seem grim as the two are unable to find any additional weakness. Or so it was until Appun remembers some crucial information on the workings of the machines after Tsunashi mentions "heaven." Things seem to be looking for the better, however they are unaware of their new enemy who lurks close by in the shadows.

title: Episode 5
synopsis: Tsunashi and Appun have a momentary relief from the mechanized infantry, but it is only a matter of time before they are back on the run. Tsunashi asks Appun if the machines have any weakness in addtion to their heads. Appun struggles out of Tsunashi's grip while denying to know anything, but has his clothes torn to reveal a tatoo on his shoulder.

title: Episode 4
synopsis: Tsunashi and Appun have a momentary relief from the mechanized infantry, but it is only a matter of time before they are back on the run. Tsunashi asks Appun if the machines have any weakness in addtion to their heads. Appun struggles out of Tsunashi's grip while denying to know anything, but has his clothes torn to reveal a tatoo on his shoulder.

title: Episode 3
synopsis: Two years have passed since the attack on Airikku. We find Tsunashi in Delmere who now makes ends meet gambling his knife juggling skills. Unfortunately, Tsunashi finds himself in a rough situation after making a small fortune off an unsavory fellow. He is rescued by Appun Desaroto, a traveller, who then asks Tsunashi if knows of Oro Meteor. However, their conversation interrupted by a group of Moribeens!

title: Episode 2b
synopsis: The "Kingdom of Bones" begins their assult without a moment for Tsunashi to grieve Yui's death. Now with the knowledge of how to awaken his powers, Tsunashi courageously lures the enemy to himself to buy some time to allow his people to escape.

title: Episode 2a
synopsis: The "Kingdom of Bones" begins an aerial assault without a moment for Tsunashi to grieve Yui's death. Imbued with knowledge on how to awaken his powers, Tsunashi courageously lures the enemy to himself to give his people a chance to escape.

title: Episode 1b
synopsis: Tsunashi steels his resolve and decides to begin his training. However, he returns home to a devastaing betray. How will he fight now that he has awakened his true powers.

title: Episode 1a
synopsis: The “Kingdom of Bones” controls other country and threatens the freedom of the world. Tsunashi, the prince of the destroyed Kingdom of Karan, has a secret power and fights against the “Kingdom of Bones.”

title: New Funimation Titles, Final Fantasy XV, and a LIFE-SIZE SNORLAX
synopsis: Tiffany joins Victoria and Miles this week to talk about new Funimation titles coming to Crunchyroll, Final Fantasy XV, the upcoming Snow Miku 2017 design, Tiffany’s epic struggle to bring a life-size Snorlax to the United States, and even more reactions to Yuri!!! on Ice — DAT KISS.

title: DJ Kirkland is here! Yuri!!! on Ice Episode 7, Persona 5, Overwatch, & Universal Japan!
synopsis: DJ Kirkland joins to talk about the new, time-limited Evangelion XR ride (Victoria raps about it) and the exclusive Detective Conan Case Closed Escape Game at Universal Japan that Reina Scully is dying to try, Persona 5, Overwatch, and all their reactions to episode 7 of Yuri!!! on Ice. We love Victor!

title: Sonic Characters in Yuri On Ice?! & Reina is Back!!!
synopsis: Reina Scully finally returns from Japan to talk about what Sonic the Hedgehog characters match Yuri!!! on ICE characters; her love of volleyball anime, Haikyu!!; limited edition Hatsune Miku figures; and much more on this week's Crunchycast!

title: Death Note Pineapple Pen and RWBY Vol.4
synopsis: The Death Note version of that Pen Pineapple Apple Pen song is SCARY! RWBY Vol.4 is showing some changes. Miles is here to tell us how he broke down America's favorite anime series. Plus, Nate Ming shares his excitement for all of the video games coming out this holiday season!

title: Yuri on Ice, Yuki Yuna, and Kyoto Animation
synopsis: Is Yuri!!! On Ice the anime of the fall season? Yuki Yuna is a Hero is getting a second season next year! And, Kyoto Animation is making an anime version of Ms. Kobayashi's Dragon Maid, instead of making more Violet Evergarden. Victoria, Miles, and Elliot discuss all this and more on Crunchycast.

title: Nintendo SWITCH & Dragon Ball Super on Crunchyroll w/ Alanah Pearce!
synopsis: Alanah Pearce of IGN joins Victoria and Bill to talk about Nintendo's newly announce Switch console, Dragon Ball Super coming to Crunchyroll, and the hottest anime of the Fall, Yuri!!! On Ice!

title: Anthony Carboni is here! Victoria's Birthday!! Yuri on Ice and Hatsune Miku VR
synopsis: This week, Anthony Carboni joins the Crunchycast gang to celebrate Victoria's Birthday!!! In the news, Akiba Souken's Top 5 Summer Anime, RWBY, and Hatsune Miku VR Future Live is available. On our watch lists this week: Yuri!!! On ICE, Time Bokan 24, and Shin Godzilla.

title: Zelda Games Ranked, PLUS Keijo!, Yuri!!! on Ice and Izetta Premiere
synopsis: This week, the Crunchycast gang ranks their favorite Zelda games. In the news, Keijo!!!!!!!! says it's a serious sports drama, there's a Flying Witch ARG in Japan to promote anime tourism, and we talk about this week's anime Blu-ray top sellers. On our watch lists this week are Yuri!!! On ICE, Izetta the Last Witch, and Natsume's Book of Friends.

title: Godzilla, The Ancient Magus' Bride and Mob Psycho's Final Episode!
synopsis: This week, hosts Victoria Holden and Reina Scully are joined by special guest Harmony, our Crunchycast production assistant. In the news, we talk about the Crunchyroll Fall Rollout, a NEW GAME! art book, and a new Godzilla movie. Victoria's started watching "The Ancient Magus' Bride" an anime that's been adapted from a manga. Part I is on Crunchyroll. Reina tells us what she thinks about the final episode of Mob Psycho 100. Harmony's been watching Orange, which also just wrapped up.

title: Mob Psycho 100, Evan's Last Crunchycast as Co-host
synopsis: In this episode, Evan, Victoria and Reina talk about the latest goings on in the world of anime including the Ghost in the Shell live-action movie and KochiKame, a manga that’s been running for a record 40 years! Plus, the gang talks about their thoughts on Mob Psycho 100 as the season draws to a close.

title: Crunchycast on FUNimation, Pokemon Mini-series, and New Game
synopsis: This week, Victoria Holden and guest co-hosts, Reina Scully and Elliot Trinidad, talk about FUNimation teaming up with Crunchyroll, anime's best voice actors, and Reina’s translation of Oreca Battle. In the news, Pokemon has a mini-series on YouTube, New Game's next Hot Springs OVA episode, and the studio behind Re:Zero is producing a new Peace Maker Kurogane anime.

title: Victoria & Evan's Top 50 Anime
synopsis: Victoria and Evan argue about their 50 favorite anime in this special 50th episode of Crunchyroll's official anime podcast, the Crunchycast!

title: Re:ZERO, Mob Psycho 100 and JoJo’s
synopsis: As the Summer anime season draws to a close, Victoria and Evan are talking about some of their favorite shows including Re:ZERO, Mob Psycho 100, New Game, and JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure.

title: Evan Goes to Otakon & "No Man’s Sky"
synopsis: This week, Evan is back from Otakon and ready to tell you and Victoria about all the great stuff he saw and did while he was there — including his favorite panels. Evan also started playing No Man’s Sky, find out what his impressions are. For the full show notes, visit http://crunchyroll.libsyn.com

title: Moyashimon, Bananya and Thunderbolt Fantasy
synopsis: This week to talk about all the new anime they're watching including Bananya, Moyashimon, and the Thunderbolt Fantasy. In the news, "In this Corner of the World" gets a November release date and the new tropical island-themed Pokémon gets a new Meowth! All that, plus answers to the anime questions you guys sent in via email, on Twitter and Facebook!

title: Under the Dog, 91 Days, Love Live! Sunshine!!
synopsis: Evan and Victoria are back together this week to talk about all the new anime they're watching including Love Live! Sunshine!!, Under the Dog and 91 Days. In the news, the ambitious fan project Moon Animate Make-up is back with another entire episode of Sailor Moon animated by over 300 different animators in various styles. Also, a dedicated fan has recreated a full-scale replica of the glider from Miyazaki's "Nausicaa of the Valley of the Wind" and it really flies! For the full show notes, visit: http://crunchyroll.libsyn.com

title: Berserk, New Game, and Akame ga Kill
synopsis: This week, Victoria is joined by a very special guest co-host, Reina Scully. In this episode, they talk about the adorable new show Bananya, Reina’s translation of Akame ga Kill, and the Berserk episode guide available on Crunchyroll. In the news, New Game, the Time Bokan 24 reboot, and new Kirito Bedsheets were released! For the full show notes, visit http://crunchyroll.libsyn.com

title: Mob Psycho 100, Re:ZERO, Pokemon Go and JRPGs
synopsis: This week, Evan, Miles and Nate talk about Mob Psycho 100, Re:ZERO, Pokemon Go and JRPGs. In the news, One Piece - Heart of Gold was finally released and the No Game, No Life movie was announced!

title: Live at Anime Expo 2016
synopsis: This week, Evan and Victoria take Crunchycast on the road to Anime Expo in Los Angeles, California. This episode was recorded on stage for Anime Expo attendees. In the news, we talk about One Punch Man coming to TV. Plus, Crunchyroll announces a huge batch of anime that we're bringing to DVD and Blu-ray with English dubs. All that plus, we're talking about our favorite things at Anime Expo (like interviewing Studio Trigger, playing Dragon Ball Xenoverse 2 and the Berserk premiere event) and we answer our live audience's anime-flavored questions. Read more at http://crunchyroll.libsyn.com/

title: Zelda: Breath of the Wild, Space Patrol Luluco and Toradora
synopsis: This week, Evan and Victoria talk about The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild, the latest episode of Space Patrol Luluco and Toradora. In the news, Sir Ian McKellen reads Archer's invocation from Fate/Stay Night, the most unpopular Pokemon launches a campaign to improve its image, and "your name" will have its world premiere at Anime Expo in Los Angeles. All that, plus answers to your anime questions! For the full show notes, visit http://crunchyroll.libsyn.com

title: Anime Conventions, Bakuon & My Hero Academia
synopsis: In this episode, Evan and Victoria talk about anime conventions like A-Kon, AnimeNEXT and Fanime. In the news, the Studio Ghibli co-founders Hayao Miyazaki and Isao Takahata speak out about the role of an artist’s gender and what Studio Ghibli has in the works including Miyazaki’s first full CGI work. Also this week, Evan and Victoria talk about some of the anime they’re watching including Bakuon and My Hero Academia. Evan is writing for Ani-Gamers and Otaku USA. Victoria is posting videos on her YouTube channel. You can find more episode of Crunchycast on Crunchyroll, YouTube, iTunes, Stitcher Radio, and our Libsyn page. The Crunchycast is hosted by Victoria Holden and Evan Minto and edited by Bill Zoeker. If you have any questions for our hosts, you can reach us at crunchycast@crunchyroll.com, or on Twitter at @SailorBee and @VamptVo respectively. The opening and ending music in Crunchycast are produced by Noah Hafford, who can be found at his SoundCloud.

title: Re:Zero, Favorite Spring Anime and Worst Pokemon Starters
synopsis: This week's episode was recorded live on Facebook Live. In this episode, Evan and Victoria are joined by Crunchyroll's resident Re:Zero expert, Miles Thomas. The news includes a poll of the worst starter Pokémon and the best Spring anime of 2016. Throughout the show, we're answering live questions asked by viewers in the chat. All that, plus the gang talks about Re:Zero, one of the best shows of the current anime season. Evan's back on Full Metal Alchemist Brotherhood and Miles is watching Flying Witch.

title: 20th Century Boys, Sakuga MADs, & Kabaneri
synopsis: This week, Victoria and Evan bring you the latest anime news including Paramount Pictures surprise posting of a full-length movie, Millennium Actress to YouTube. Then, they dig into the latest episode of Kabaneri, Evan talks about the Sakuga MADs he's been watching on YouTube and fills you in on 20th Century Boys manga. All that, plus answers to the questions you guys sent in and posted in the comments. For the full show notes, check out http://crunchyroll.libsyn.com

title: Space Patrol LULUCO, Kabaneri and Anime Coffins
synopsis: This week’s Crunchycast was recorded live and streamed to Facebook Live! Every week, Crunchycast hosts Evan Minto and Victoria Holden bring you everything that’s going on in the world of anime. In the news we talk about the new starters coming to Pokemon Sun and Moon, an anime-themed coffin and a crazy detective drama that’s loosely based on characters from The Legend of Zelda. Also in this episode, we talk about some of the anime we’ve been watching including Kabaneri, Space Patrol LULUCO, Twin Star Exorcists and Re:Zero. All that, plus answers to the questions asked by our live viewers. For the full show notes, check out http://crunchyroll.libsyn.com!

title: LULUCO, Sailor Moon Crystal, & JoJo's Bizarre Adventure
synopsis: This week, Victoria and Evan talk about some of their favorite shows from the Spring 2016 anime season. Their favorites include SPACE PATROL LULUCO, JoJo's Bizarre Adventure, Sailor Moon Crystal, and the new Teekyu Spin-off. Also, Evan's been checking out an anime from the seventies called Captain Harlock, which is available to stream on Crunchyroll. All that, plus Victoria talks about her trip to Japan and answers to your questions! For the full show notes, check out http://crunchyroll.libsyn.com!

title: KIZNAIVER, KADOKAWA and JOKER GAME
synopsis: This week on the Crunchycast, host Evan Minto is joined on the big orange couch by Crunchyroll's Tiffany Chen and Nate Ming. After a brief intro to Tiffany's and Nate's roles at Crunchyroll, the gang talks about Twitter's crush on Ellen Baker, the super-kawaii Japanese text book english teacher. Also, Crunchyroll and KADOKAWA announce a strategic alliance that will bring even more must-watch anime to Crunchyroll subscribers. Then, Nate tells us about his visit to Bandai Namco's HQ. All that, plus KIZNAIVER, JOKER GAME and answers to your burning anime questions. For the full show notes, check out http://crunchyroll.libsyn.com!

title: SPACE PATROL LULUCO, Miitomo and WrestleMania 32
synopsis: This week Evan Minto is joined by special guests from the Crunchyroll crew, Sam Wolfe and Danika Harrod. In this episode, we’re totally addicted to Miitomo, Nintendo’s first big entry in world of mobile apps and games. Strangely, WrestleMania 32 is relevant this week because anime was a big part of the event, due in no small part to the fact that The New Day loves Dragon Ball Z. We also talk about the Spring anime season. The gang is watching SPACE PATROL LULUCO and loving it. We’re all looking forward to Joker Game. Evan has the new season of Jojo’s Bizarre Adventure on his watch list. All that, plus answers to your questions! For the full show notes, check out http://crunchyroll.libsyn.com!

title: Fire Emblem Family Feud: Nohrians vs. Hoshidans
synopsis: This week we explain why we disappeared for two weeks -- time moves differently in Japan. Victoria’s headed to Anime Boston, where Crunchyroll is the presenting sponsor. If you’re a Crunchyroll Premiere member, pick up a Crunchyroll Premiere BADGE at the registration desk to get the VIP treatment at Anime Boston. Evan announces that Crunchyroll will be adding “JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Diamond is Unbreakable” to its Anime Simulcasts starting April 1st. Evan and Victoria are both playing Fire Emblem Fates. Find out who’s fighting for Nohr and who’s on Hoshido’s side. All that, plus answers to your questions! For the full show notes, check out http://crunchyroll.libsyn.com!

title: KONOSUBA and a Haircut
synopsis: This week Victoria just started watching KONOSUBA, and one of the first scenes is a nod to video game preorder bonuses. We’re still watching ERASED and you should be too! Then, after you watch ERASED, you should watch ERASED: Group Watch, a Crunchyroll after-show for ERASED. It’s on Crunchyroll.com and YouTube so find it in those places! All that, plus the latest anime news and answers to your questions. For the full show notes, check out http://crunchyroll.libsyn.com!

title: Penguins Taste Like Prinnies
synopsis: This week we talk about ERASED episode 7 putting the series back on track - and whether it ever really went off the track. Evan’s still talking about Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood. Victoria went to a game launch event held by NISA and had a blast. She may also have eaten a penguin. Evan’s getting in line for RightStuf’s Discotek sale. Find out what’s in his cart! All that, plus answers to your questions. For the full show notes, check out http://crunchyroll.libsyn.com!

title: Live action Astro Boy, Fire Emblem and Zatch Bell!
synopsis: This week we talk about Evan possibly finishing Fire Emblem Awakening in time for the release of Fire Emblem Fates. We weigh in on the news that Astro Boy may get his own live-action movie. Plus, If you were planning on watching Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood, better do it quick before FUNimation loses their license. All that, plus our thoughts on Katsucon 2016 AND answers to your anime and non-anime questions. For the full show notes, check out http://crunchyroll.libsyn.com!

title: We Like Phantom World AND Petting Mini-Games
synopsis: This week we talk about Myriad Colors Phantom World, why we like it and why people aren’t sticking around past episode 1. Also, we thought they were going to remove the magical petting mini-game from the western release of Fire Emblem Fates. But lucky for us, it’s still kinda there. In the news, the “Legend of Zelda - Twilight Princess” manga debuts and Crunchyroll announces that we’ll be simulcasting Trigger’s newly announced SPACE PATROL LULUCO anime series. All that, plus “Robot Carnival” with robot love stories AND answers to your burning anime-flavored questions! For the full show notes, check out http://crunchyroll.libsyn.com!

title: Ep. 29 - with Special Guest Miranda Sanchez of IGN Anime Club
synopsis: Guest Miranda Sanchez (@HavokRose) from the IGN Anime Club Podcast joins Evan Minto and Victoria Holden in the Crunchycast Studio. This week, the gang discusses the Winter 2016 anime season. Miranda’s watching ERASED & Phantom World, a show that made Victoria cry. Evan’s on a Sherlock Holmes kick and Miranda’s obsessed with Genos (and Undertale) fan art. All that, plus your questions answered and much more. For the full show notes, check out http://crunchyroll.libsyn.com!

title: A Big 'Ol Bag of Ice
synopsis: On this week's Crunchycast, Victoria and Evan talk about some of the shows that are on their watch list including Dragon Half, an OVA from the 90s and Erased. In the news, they uncover the rumors surrounding a possible TV adaptation of Akira and consider the size of Kamen Rider's belt. All that, plus answers to your burning questions and more! For the full show notes, check out http://crunchyroll.libsyn.com!

title: You're My Life-Sized Lum
synopsis: Victoria and Evan chat about BBK/BRNK, then answer a bunch of fan questions, covering subjects like virtual reality anime, shows that haven't aged well, and the coolest spots to visit in Tokyo. Plus, more dating advice! For the full show notes, check out http://crunchyroll.libsyn.com!

title: How Many "Bo's" in Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo?
synopsis: This week Victoria and Evan take a look at the new Winter 2016 season and discuss their favorite first episodes of the newest shows! Evan is looking forward to more ERASED, Victoria doesn't know what she feels about Active Raid and both of them agree BBK/BRNK has potential. For the full show notes, check out http://crunchyroll.libsyn.com!

title: An Average Human Mother
synopsis: After a two-week break for the holidays (during which we posted a podcast blooper reel on Crunchyroll and released the Crunchyroll Holiday Special), Victoria and Evan are back in the office to talk about the upcoming anime they're excited about, the state of anime convention attendance going into 2016, and the 1980s time capsule that is Fight! Iczer One. For the full show notes, check out http://crunchyroll.libsyn.com!

title: Blooper Reel
synopsis: Evan and Victoria are off for the holidays, but we've got a special bonus video for Crunchycast fans! This blooper reel is a glimpse behind the scenes at the nonsense that happens before every episode of the podcast. Thank you for watching this year! See you in 2016!

title: The Best Anime of 2015
synopsis: This is our last episode of 2015 as Victoria and Evan will be out of the office for the holidays, so the hosts take some time to discuss their favorite anime of the year, including TV series, movies, and more! We asked for listeners to send their own favorites, so there's a lot to talk about, including Aldnoah.Zero, Shirobako, Rokka, Yatterman Night, and Animator Expo. Correction: Evan said Dentsu is funding Animator Expo, but it's actually Japanese media company Dwango. Sorry! For the full show notes, check out http://crunchyroll.libsyn.com!

title: I Was Born in the Darkness
synopsis: This week Victoria and Evan learn the power of anime training via fanservice-y fitness series Anime De Training! Ex and the JoJo's Bizarre Adventure manga, and Evan tries out Samurai Champloo. Plus discussion of Final Fantasy VII, the death of Shigeru Mizuki, and Victoria's limited exposure to American media. For the full show notes, check out http://crunchyroll.libsyn.com!

title: Simba is Naruto
synopsis: NOTE: We had an issue with our camera this week, so the video is blurry in some places. We hope to have it fixed next week! In this inadvertently stationery-themed episode, Evan marvels at the impact of a pencil shortage in the anime industry and Victoria discusses the benefits of taking notes while watching anime. Plus the hosts chat about the Samurai Jack sequel, Mr. Osomatsu, and Cardcaptor Sakura. For the full show notes, check out http://crunchyroll.libsyn.com!

title: Butts off to You
synopsis: It's a good day for good hips as Evan and Victoria discuss Space Adventure Cobra, the made-up Japanese holiday Good Hips Day, Ghost in the Shell: The New Movie, and the Monogatari series. Then it's question time, and this week our hosts get to answer TWO relationship advice questions! For the full show notes, check out crunchyroll.libsyn.com!

title: Who's Your Favorite Matsu?
synopsis: This week Evan and Victoria talk about Young Black Jack's shirt, patchwork body, the terrifying harem in Oreshura, online anime petitions, and the ongoing debate over who is Best Matsu. Plus answers to your questions, including our favorite villains and whether or not it's OK to call anime "cartoons." For the full show notes, please check out crunchyroll.libsyn.com! less

title: My Curry is a Pilot
synopsis: This week Evan and Victoria discuss sad teenagers in The Anthem of the Heart, Chris Brown's manga-"inspired" album cover, Tales of Zestiria, and the best way to get into older anime.

title: Eva's Bad, It's Super Bad
synopsis: Evan and Victoria return to the orange couch to catch up on the biggest anime news out of Hollywood, New York Comic Con, and White Base.

title: Restricted Rock-Paper-Scissors
synopsis: Our hosts Evan and Victoria take over CreativeBug studios to talk about high-stakes gambling adventures in Kaiji and whether or not it's ok to like Monster Musume.

title: Isn't Everybody Talking About Kojima's Pants?
synopsis: Crunchyroll Brand Manager Danika Harrod joins Crunchycast hosts Evan and Victoria to consider a potential FLCL remake, Metal Gear Solid References in Monster Musume, and take a look back on Rayearth and Akira.

title: Actually, I Am... a Video!
synopsis: Evan and Victoria host the Crunchycast's video debut! Two cameras join the podcast to capture our hosts' excitement about the upcoming releases of Takahata's "Only Yesterday" and the Devilman vs Cyborg 009 crossover, and Evan and Victoria imagine the perfect anime that they would trap each other inside. For the full show notes, please check out crunchyroll.libsyn.com!

title: No One Could Make That Shot with Nate Ming
synopsis: Crunchyroll Features Editor and Customer Support Lead Nate Ming joins Evan and Victoria to talk about anime devils and the differences between selfie sticks and M16s. Find more information at crunchyroll.libsyn.com!

title: Harem Anime is Exactly Like Football
synopsis: Coil up with your favorite monster girl for the long-awaited return of Crunchycast! Evan and Victoria grace the mics once more to chat about everything from Sherlock Hound to Freeza's new color.

title: Putting the "Dom" in Fandom with Max Scoville
synopsis: This week, our hosts are joined by Max Scoville of IGN and The Comedy Button to talk Prison School, Gall Force, and Food Wars!

title: This is What Doujins are For with Lauren Orsini
synopsis: Lauren Orsini, the Otaku Journalist, meets up with Evan and Victoria to talk about her new book, Build Your Anime Blog, as well as Gunslinger Stratos and anime soundtracks!

title: Is It Wrong to Try to Pick Up Tom Zoth in a Dungeon?
synopsis: Hungry Bug Diner's Tom Zoth trades stories with the CrunchyCast hosts about Punchline, football punting, and Ninja Slayer!

title: "Meme Risk" with Deb Aoki
synopsis: Manga industry expert Deb Aoki shares her insights about the ubiquity of the Love Live! game in Japan, the Eisner awards, and a critical look at the manga industry in the US.

title: Prescribing Anime with Tiffako
synopsis: Crunchyroll Brand Manager Tiffako chats about anime licensing with Evan and Victoria in between conversations on the live-action Ghost in the Shell, Triage X, and Kraken Con!

title: Episode 7Evan - Mail Bag
synopsis: CrunchyCast hosts Victoria and Evan answer your exciting questions, from topics ranging from the grotesque Lychee Light Club to the marketed audiences of magical girls to dakimakura usage.

title: The Michaels of Anime Boston
synopsis: Victoria runs into Mike Toole and Mike Sinterniklaas at Anime Boston, while back at headquarters, Evan continues to watch Sherlock Hound and have bad opinions.

title: Dog Eat Dog Podcast with Nick Robinson
synopsis: Polygon video producer Nick Robinson hops on the CrunchyCast to enjoy April Fools Jokes with CrunchyCast hosts Evan and Victoria while exploring both new spring anime and favorites from the winter quarter.

title: Pudding Fights, Cheese Blades, and Daryl Surat
synopsis: Daryl Surat, the Most Dangerous man in podcasting, meets up with CrunchyCast hosts Victoria and Evan for an episode full of convention horror stories and gdgd Fairies.

title: Mario and Luigi: Otome Game
synopsis: Join the CrunchyCast hosts as they explore the world of anime - this week, Evan's excited about MAPPA's upcoming film "In This Corner of the World" and Victoria looks back on Wake Up Girls! in anticipation of the new series in the franchise!

title: Really Dumb And All Real (Ninja Powers)
synopsis: In a post-Inferno Cop world, Evan and Victoria look forward to Monster Musume, and Evan has to guess whether Victoria is describing actual powers held by characters in Naruto or making the whole thing up!

title: No Matter What
synopsis: Meet the CrunchyCast hosts Victoria and Evan as they share their perspectives on the latest news and anime out of Japan, and answer questions from the incredible Crunchyroll community!

title: Episode 20
synopsis: Ochibi-san is greeted by and unexpected guest as Mametsubu-cho comes to life as spring returns.

title: Episode 19
synopsis: The greedy Pankui demands a big sweet rice puff. But what is this that he gets instead?

title: Episode 18
synopsis: Nazeni is sick in be with a cold. He plans on going to look for the spring's bounty once he gets better.

title: Episode 17
synopsis: Ochibi-san's snow creation must hold some importance to him...

title: Episode 16
synopsis: Ochibi-san takes revenge on the mischievous mice! Then he gains weight over the New Years holiday.

title: Episode 15
synopsis: Time is not on Ochibi-san's side as he becomes busier as the day grows shorter as winter approaches Mametsubu-cho.

title: Episode 14
synopsis: There are many alluring smells coming every which direction in town. But what is this delicious aroma coming from Ochibi-san?

title: Episode 13
synopsis: We find the bounties of autumn growing from Ochibi-san? The secret of Ochibi-san's hat is revealed, don't tell anyone!

title: Episode 12
synopsis: Jack busies himself writing insults about everyone, but...

title: Episode 11
synopsis: We get a glimpse into Ochibi-san's secret pastime.

title: Episode 10
synopsis: What is it that Ochibi-san is chasing? The seasons have changed, and so have his clothes!

title: Episode 9
synopsis: Only the final remnants of the summer heat lingers in the air. Has Ochibi-san finished everything he wanted to do in the summer?

title: Episode 8
synopsis: Ochibi-san cool off far too much in an air conditioned room. He plans on warming up with a bath, but...

title: Episode 7
synopsis: Ochibi-san visits the beach, but it's packed! Will he be able to escape from the crowd in one piece?

title: Episode 6
synopsis: The miraculous relationship between Ochibi-san and a ball. And what is this box that Pankui uses to raise bread about?

title: Episode 5
synopsis: Mametsubu-cho at dusk. Ochibi-san finally reveals his hobby.

title: Episode 4
synopsis: Pankui visits Ochibi-san's house bearing some gifts. It seems like he is offering his bread as a token of their friendship.

title: Episode 3
synopsis: Ochibi-san looks like he's going out with his umbrella on a rainy day. It's just another idyllic day in Mametsubu-cho.

title: Episode 2
synopsis: Join Ochibi-san, Nazeni, and Pankui in their daily life as the seasons pass in Mametsubu-cho. It seems like Ochibi-san has something he would like to share with us.

title: Episode 1
synopsis: The sudden spring showers, sunflowers in full blossom in summer, and the chilly winds of winter, these are just a few of things that remind us of the passing seasons. Join Ochibi-san, Nazeni, and Pankui in their daily life as the seasons pass in Mametsubu-cho.

title: Shibuya Under Attack!
synopsis: Team Momo is pushed to the limit as aliens expand their invasion to Kyoto.

synopsis: Wonder Momo and Amazona team up to battle deadly Acroballs in Odaiba.

title: The True Enemy By My Side?
synopsis: Natsuhiko attempts to cheer Momoko up in the aftermath of her encounter with Akiho.

synopsis: Momoko discovers another idol with a powersuit as aliens invade an idol event in Akihabara.

synopsis: Wannabe pop star and swimsuit idol Momoko is given a powersuit by a mysterious alien figure.

synopsis: Press Event Video
